page.title: 19"PICK YOUR OWN" at OFFCHURCH
page.content: One of the popular ways to spend a Summer day in the 1980's is to take the family to a{"Pick Your Own"}Fruit Farm, like the one near Offchurch. On a sunny Saturday, as many as 50 cars can be seen there parked on the grassy picnic area with more cars coming and going each minute. {Each family group}goes first to a large kiosk to receive baskets. People then make their way into the nearby fields on foot or wait for one of the tractor pulled{"fruit trains". }On their return to the kiosk the fruit is weighed and paid for. {PRICES THIS YEAR:_ { }Strawberries - 42p per lb. Raspberries - 56p per lb Gooseberries - 20p per lb Toilet facilities and ice creams are available and fresh cream can be bought.{A pleasant day out!
